Allocation Process Flow

 

 

The allocation process flow can be divided into three broad stages:

  • Allocation Pre-requisites

  • Allocation review and approval

  • Post-approval
     

Allocation pre-requisites

This stage is for the prerequisites required for the system to run allocation. It can be further divided into the following steps:

 

Create Master data

In this step, all the master data required for the allocation process is configured or interfaced. This includes item and size items, stores and DCs, business calendars, etc.

 

Interface Transactional data

In this step, all transactional data that can be used for allocation inventory is interfaced. This includes inventory, plan metrics, and historical metrics.

 

Configure Allocation methods

The formula to compute allocation needs is configured in this step.

 

Configure Allocation Strategies

In this step, the business rules for allocating the inventory are configured. These business rules will govern the system-driven inventory allocation.

 

Allocation Review and Approval

The output of the system generated and allocated is reviewed and approved by the allocator’s supervisors after these results are found to be in line with the business guidelines.

 

Users can either approve the allocations or reject them.

 

Post Approval:

Once the allocations are approved, they are approved for further action. This includes releasing the allocations and generating distribution orders for the DCs.
